div.p: This term belongs within WRITING RECEPTION . However, it is to be used in a CHRONSTRUCT if possible, and a CHRONSTRUCT marking publication is generally within a PRODUCTION tag. It refers to a work that, in our opinion, broke new ground, was in some shocking or notorious or illuminating, or had major social or literary repercussions. It should contain a full sentence and the one title that specifies the landmark text. If used in CHRONSTRUCT, this element contributes to the MILESTONES column of the Overview Screen. It has no mandatory or optional sub-elements or attributes.

See RBESTKNOWNWORK for comparison purposes. Note that landmark refers to the world view and not only to the writer's own oeuvre. It is used at all in a minority of entries, but it is possible in rare cases for a woman writer to have two landmark texts, especially if they occur in different genres.
